pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.4: The six are linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp; see Pli Tv Kd 8:3.1.6.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.10: According to VIN VN ṭ.1626 (presumably commenting on kaddamena in the Kaṅkhāvitaraṇī commentary): Kaddamenāti udakānukaddamasukkhakaddamādiṁ saṅgaṇhāti, “With mud means: water with mud, dry mud, etc., is included.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.3.7: I understand anuvāta and paribhaṇḍa to refer to long borders and short borders respectively.
